content.description: This route is mapped out in Randy Vogel's book, but no mention anywhere else.  Starts off inside a shaded area with a chimney.  Fun climb.  Set your pro high on the traverse to avoid getting your rope snagged.  Extend your quickdraw at the end of the traverse to avoid drag.
content.protection: small/medium cams and assorted nuts.  Gear anchor.  You can easily walk off to the right.
content.location: This is right of Enter the Dragon in the Gunsmoke area.

content.description: Crux is dependent on size of your chest or a$$, or if you're chimney averse.
content.protection: #6 is nice for the direct top-out, the chimney protects well with a #2 BD.
content.location: This is the obvious chimney on the right side of the Killer Cracks formation.

content.description:
Note: This route no longer exists due to rockfall in February 2003.  The description remains for historical significance only.

A fist crack out a short roof right off the ground leads to a squeeze chimney. What looks like heinous offwidthing around the lip of the roof is made much easier by a "thank god" hold inside the crack. Squeeze and standard chimneying lead to the top. Might deserve an "s" rating as it's hard to protect higher though the climbing is easy and it's not a chimney that you're likely to fall out of. Gear anchor and descend a low angle chimney behind and to the right of the route.
content.protection: Fist sized to the biggest you got. The crux is low and can be protected with 2.5-5" gear. The climbing above in the chimney is easier but you'd need #4 big bros to protect it if at all.

content.description:
Note: This route no longer exists due to rockfall in February 2003.  The description remains for historical significance only.

This climb is one of Killer Cracks, which lie to the right of the famous Gunsmoke traverse. This takes the obvious offwidth/chimney crack, which affords good training for those long routes with mandatory wide sections (Epinepherine at Red Rocks comes to mind).

A good climb to work on your wide crack skills while waiting in line at Gunsmoke.
content.protection: A few wide pieces may work, but if not...you are the pro!
